metadata.Title: CVE-2021-35472 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in LemonLDAP::NG before 2.0.12. Session cache corruption can lead to authorization bypass or spoofing. By running a loop that makes many authentication attempts, an attacker might alternately be authenticated as one of two different users.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-35472` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

lemonldap-ng - 2.0.11+ds-4
lemonldap-ng-fastcgi-server - 2.0.11+ds-4
lemonldap-ng-handler - 2.0.11+ds-4
lemonldap-ng-uwsgi-app - 2.0.11+ds-4
liblemonldap-ng-common-perl - 2.0.11+ds-4
liblemonldap-ng-handler-perl - 2.0.11+ds-4
liblemonldap-ng-manager-perl - 2.0.11+ds-4
liblemonldap-ng-portal-perl - 2.0.11+ds-4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: lemonldap-ng package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.0.11+ds-4').
